message.content:
cs.CR, cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.CY, cs.SOC

This paper deals with the intersection of spamming and cryptocurrencies, specifically Bitcoin. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). The paper also involves analyzing the financial structure of sextortion campaigns, which involves tracking monetary flows, suggesting the category cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms). The use of Bitcoin and its blockchain also involves aspects of cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) and cs.CY (Computers and Society). Finally, the paper discusses the profitability of sextortion spamming, which falls under the category cs.SOC (Social and Economic Systems).
